author: cnbc.com
title: Calix reports 4Q loss
text:
PETALUMA, Calif. (AP) _ Calix Inc. (CALX) on Tuesday reported a loss of $12.9 million in its fourth quarter.
The Petaluma, California-based company said it had a loss of 25 cents per share. Losses, adjusted for stock option expense and restructuring costs, were 15 cents per share.
The results fell short of Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of five analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for a loss of 13 cents per share.
The maker of telecommunications equipment posted revenue of $137.9 million in the period, which also fell short of Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $142.3 million.
For the year, the company reported that its loss widened to $83 million, or $1.66 per share. Revenue was reported as $510.4 million.
For the current quarter ending in April, Calix expects its results to range from a loss of 20 cents per share to a loss of 16 cents per share.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $102 million to $108 million for the fiscal first quarter.
Calix shares have risen 12 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $6.65, a decrease of roughly 9 percent in the last 12 months.
